response.original_title: The Rich & Poor 1000 Player Civilization Experiment
response.overview: Out of 8000+ applicants, 1300 players were accepted to play in the 1000 Player Civilization Experiment. Before the event began, players selected which island they wanted to join without knowing the traits of each island. Each day, all players logged on at the same time, and session lasted around 2-3 hours. For the most part, players could do whatever they want. The creator did set a few limitations on the players to promote a better experience, like banning random killing (RDM), disabling most Minecraft enchantments, disabling unrealistic items like ender pearls, disabling other dimensions like the Nether, and a few more misc. rules.  While most of the footage and plot information in this video accurately represents what actually happened in this event, some moments have been modified, reshot, or entirely fabricated for purposes of simplification or storytelling.
response.tagline: The Biggest Social Experiment in Minecraft History.
